title.narrative: Promoting self-reliance for refugees and vulnerable host community in ElRedis II and Jouri

description.narrative: The project aims to improve well-being and livelihood resilience for the vulnerable women and men in ElRedis II and Jouri. The project targeted directly 480 refugees and vulnerable host community members through 80 HHs. The outcomes of the project are; vulnerable women and men in in ElRedis II and Jouri achieve improved household food security and improved income security. The two outcomes will be achieved through provision of agro and livestock farming inputs and development of strong community based enterprises. Key project output include: Output 1: 80 beneficiaries (60 host community and 20 refugees) food insecure households supported with quality seeds, tools, veterinary inputs and extension services. -Output 2: 250 Refugees and host communities trained and provided with start-up kits for village saving and loans associations. -Output 3: 140 unemployed Refugees and host community youth and women have improved capacity in income generating activities, Agro-forestry management skills and fuel efficiency. The main project activities are; vegetable production and enterprise development. The project will have initial activity on people and communities’ selection for the project through a participatory approach. Under vegetable production a group of 20 men will be supported to do vegetable growing in 10 feddans leased for a year. The vegetable production will further be supported through mechanised ploughing of the land, hire of watering pumping systems, fencing and extension services. On activities under enterprise development there will be training on business management for 45 households, provision of start-up capital to 40 women in the income generation groups and formation of 4 marketing association for handcrafts and embroidery small and medium entrepreneur. In addition one group of women (15 member) will supported with a cereals/ grain grinding machines for income generation. The project will seek to strengthen capacity of the targeted people through training on values chain for 60 people and connecting 20 hand craft and embroidery producer groups with traders in Kosti and Alsalam locality for marketing opportunities. There will be monitoring which will be contacted by both CAFOD and ASSIST during the project implementation.
